Konsumsi BBM Naik, Pembangunan Kilang Minyak Pertamina Dikebut
02 Nov 2019, 06:30 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kementerian Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) akan mempercepat pengembangan kilang PT Pertamina (Persero) agar bisa selesai tepat waktu, seiring dengan kebutuhan konsumsi bahan bakar minyak (BBM) yang terus membumbung. Saat ini, dari empat proyek pengembangan, baru dua yang sudah bergulir, yaitu Kilang Balikpapan dan Kilang Cilacap.
Menteri ESDM Arifin Tasrif mengakui proyek kilang yang digarap bersama Saudi Aramco memang harus dikebut. Ia pun menyatakan siap mendorong dan memberikan dukungan kepada Pertamina agar proyek kilang ini cepat selesai.
Arifin mengakui juga bahwa kebutuhan BBM akan terus bertambah seiring meningkatkan permintaan. Namun, pembangunan dan pengembangan kilang membutuhkan tahapan-tahapan perencanaan pembangunan dan pengembangan sehingga butuh waktu yang tak singkat.
Namun, Arifin optimistis salah satu proyek pengembangan kilang ini bisa selesai dalam 5 tahun ke depan. “Yang RDMP [refinery development master plan] pasti mungkin, pasti bisa selesai,” katanya.
Saat ini, proyek Kilang Balikpapan Pertamina sudah memasuki tahap konstruksi. Pertamina telah menandatangani kontrak rekayasa, pengadaan, dan konstruksi (engineering procurement and construction/EPC) dengan SK Engineering & Construction Co. Ltd., Hyundai Engineering Co. Ltd., PT Rekayasa Industri, dan PT PP (Persero) Tbk.
Untuk Kilang Cilacap, Pertamina masih melakukan negosiasi dengan Saudi Aramco selaku mitra terkait valuasi aset yang dibutuhkan untuk pembentukan perusahaan patungan.
Berdasarkan data Pertamina, pada 2023 Kilang Balikpapan fase I dan Balongan fase I dijadwalkan mulai beroperasi. Pada saat itu, kapasitas kilang perseroan naik dari 1 juta barel per hari (bph) menjadi 1,1 juta bph.
Selain itu, Kilang Cilacap ditargetkan mulai beroperasi pada 2025. Yang terakhir, proyek Pertamina RDMP Balikpapan fase 2, RDMP Balongan fase 2, dan kilang petrokimia Balongan ditargetkan selesai pada 2026.

Fuel Consumption Increases, Pertamina Oil Refinery Development Speeded Up
02 Nov 2019, 06:30 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) will accelerate the development of the PT Pertamina (Persero) refinery so that it can be completed on time, in line with the growing need for fuel consumption (BBM). At present, of the four development projects, only two have been rolling, namely the Balikpapan refinery and the Cilacap refinery.
ESDM Minister Arifin Tasrif acknowledged that the refinery project that was undertaken with Saudi Aramco must indeed be accelerated. He also stated that he was ready to encourage and provide support to Pertamina so that the refinery project would be completed quickly.
Arifin also admitted that fuel demand will continue to grow as demand increases. However, the construction and development of refineries requires stages of development planning and development so that it takes no short time.
However, Arifin is optimistic that one of the refinery development projects will be completed within the next 5 years. "The RDMP [refinery development master plan] is definitely possible, it will definitely be finished," he said.
At present, the Pertamina Balikpapan Refinery project has entered the construction phase. Pertamina has signed an engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract with SK Engineering & Construction Co. Ltd., Hyundai Engineering Co. Ltd., PT Rekayasa Industri, and PT PP (Persero) Tbk.
For the Cilacap Refinery, Pertamina is still negotiating with Saudi Aramco as a partner regarding asset valuation needed to form a joint venture.
Based on Pertamina data, in 2023 the Phase I Balikpapan Refinery and Phase I Balongan are scheduled to start operating. At that time, the company's refinery capacity rose from 1 million barrels per day (bpd) to 1.1 million bpd.
In addition, the Cilacap Refinery is targeted to start operating in 2025. Finally, the Pertamina RDMP Balikpapan phase 2 project, Balongan RDMP phase 2, and the Balongan petrochemical refinery are targeted to be completed in 2026.
